display_name: MSLT: Stanford Sleepiness Scale Prior to Nap 2
description:
Score from Stanford Sleepiness Scale (SSS). A subjective measure of sleepiness from 1-7, where higher scores indicate more sleepiness (Hoddes, E., & Dement, W. Z. V (1972). The development and use of the Stanford Sleepiness Scale (SSS). Psychophysiology, 9, 150.)

[Search for all Stanford Sleepiness Scale variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/wsc/variables?search=sss)

Variable from a Multiple Sleep Latency Test (MSLT), [Roehrs & Roth 1992 (PubMed ID: 1552009)](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/1552009/).

[Search for all Multiple Sleep Latency Test variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/wsc/variables?search=mslt)
